intro: Racosperma quadrilaterale, commonly known as the quadrilateral acacia, is a species of flowering plant in the Fabaceae family. It is native to eastern Australia and is characterized by its slender, often woody stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in compact inflorescences, which are followed by flat, elongated pods. It is typically found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to coastal and inland environments. Racosperma quadrilaterale is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in harsh conditions.
